SEARCH
Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.ftp

Class FTPConnection

java.lang.Object
org.bluezoo.gumdrop.Connection
org.bluezoo.gumdrop.LineBasedConnection
org.bluezoo.gumdrop.ftp.FTPConnection
All Implemented Interfaces:
ChannelHandler
public class FTPConnection extends LineBasedConnection
Connection handler for the FTP protocol. This manages one TCP control connection.
Author:
Chris Burdess

    • receive

      public void receive(ByteBuffer buf)
      Description copied from class: Connection
      Called when application data is received from the peer. SSL decryption is handled automatically if this is a secure connection. Public to allow direct testing without reflection.
      Specified by:
      receive in class Connection
      Parameters:
      buf - the application data received

    • lineReceived

      protected void lineReceived(ByteBuffer line)
      Called when a complete CRLF-terminated line has been received. Decodes the line and dispatches the FTP command.
      Specified by:
      lineReceived in class LineBasedConnection
      Parameters:
      line - buffer containing the complete line including CRLF

    • disconnected

      protected void disconnected() throws IOException
      Called when the connection is closed by the peer. Uses try-finally to guarantee telemetry completion and resource cleanup.
      Specified by:
      disconnected in class Connection
      Throws:
      IOException

    • sendLine

      protected void sendLine(String line) throws IOException
      Sends a line of text to the client without a reply code. Used for multi-line responses where intermediate lines don't include the code.
      Parameters:
      line - the line to send (without CRLF)
      Throws:
      IOException

    • doEprt

      protected void doEprt(String args) throws IOException
      EXTENDED PORT (RFC 2428) - IPv6 compatible active mode. Format: |protocol|address|port| Protocol: 1 = IPv4, 2 = IPv6
      Throws:
      IOException

    • doEpsv

      protected void doEpsv(String args) throws IOException
      EXTENDED PASSIVE (RFC 2428) - IPv6 compatible passive mode. Response format: 229 Entering Extended Passive Mode (|||port|) The client uses the control connection's IP address.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • doAuth

      protected void doAuth(String args) throws IOException
      AUTH command (RFC 4217) - Authentication/Security Mechanism. Initiates TLS upgrade of the control connection.
      Parameters:
      args - the security mechanism (TLS or SSL)
      Throws:
      IOException

    • doPbsz

      protected void doPbsz(String args) throws IOException
      PBSZ command (RFC 4217) - Protection Buffer Size. Must be issued after AUTH and before PROT. For TLS, the only valid value is 0.
      Parameters:
      args - the buffer size (must be 0 for TLS)
      Throws:
      IOException

    • doProt

      protected void doProt(String args) throws IOException
      PROT command (RFC 4217) - Data Channel Protection Level. Must be issued after PBSZ.
      Parameters:
      args - the protection level: C (Clear), S (Safe), E (Confidential), P (Private)
      Throws:
      IOException

    • doCcc

      protected void doCcc(String args) throws IOException
      CCC command (RFC 4217) - Clear Command Channel. Downgrades control connection to cleartext while keeping data protected. This is rarely used and potentially dangerous, so we don't support it.
      Parameters:
      args - should be null
      Throws:
      IOException

    • doFeat

      protected void doFeat(String args) throws IOException
      FEAT command (RFC 2389) - Feature List. Returns the list of extensions supported by this server.
      Parameters:
      args - should be null
      Throws:
      IOException

    • isDataProtectionEnabled

      public boolean isDataProtectionEnabled()
      Returns whether data connections should be TLS-protected.
      Returns:
      true if PROT P is active
